text: Yuncheng is the southernmost prefecture-level city in Shanxi province, People's Republic of China. It borders Linfen and Jincheng municipalities to the north and east, and Henan and Shaanxi provinces to the south and west. At the 2010 census, its population was 5,134,779 inhabitants, of whom 680,036 lived in the built-up (or metro) area made of Yanhu District. ==History== AMS, 1958) In early China, it was the location of the state of Kunwu (). ==Administration== The Municipal executive, legislature and judiciary are in Yanhu District (), together with the CPC and Public Security Bureau. {| class="wikitable" !colspan="7" align="center" | Map |- |colspan="7" align="center" | |- ! Due to its southerly location and position to the north of the Zhongtiao Mountains, allowing for downsloping when winds are from the south, it is among the warmest locales in the province. Winters are cold and very dry, while summers are hot and humid. Monthly mean temperatures range from in January to in July, and the annual mean is . Over 60% of the annual rainfall occurs from June to September. With monthly percent possible sunshine ranging from 45% in March to 54% in May and July, the city receives 2,219 hours of bright sunshine annually, low by Shanxi standards and north China. ==Notable Residents== * Guan Yu, general and deified historical figure * English author Justin Hill lived and worked in Yuncheng from 1992–1995.
